data.title: IC 549 - Irregular Galaxy in Sextans
data.meta_description: Complete details of deep sky object IC 549 in the constellation of Sextans.
data.text:
IC 549 is a Irregular Galaxy in the Sextans constellation. IC 549 is situated close to the celestial equator and, as such, it is at least partly visible from both hemispheres in certain times of the year. Given its B magnitude of 14.8, IC 549 is visible with the help of a telescope having an aperture of 20 inches (500mm) or more.

The image below is a photograph of IC 549 from the Digitized Sky Survey 2 (DSS2 - see the credits section) taken in the red channel. The area of sky represented in the image is 0.5000x0.5000 degrees (30.00x30.00 arcmins).

Celestial Coordinates

Apparent

Right Ascension 09h 41m 59s

Declination +03° 50’ 49”

Hour Angle 04h 28m 32s

Sideral Time 14h 10m 31s

J2000

Right Ascension 09h 40m 42s

Declination +03° 57’ 35”

Finder Chart

The simplified sky charts below show the position of IC 549 in the sky. The first chart has a field of view of 60° while the second one has a field of view of 10°.

Photometric Information

The following table lists the magnitude of IC 549 in different bands of the electomagnetic spectrum (when available), from the B band (445nm wavelength, corresponding to the Blue color), to the V band ( 551nm wavelength, corresponding to Green/Yellow color), to the J, H, K bands (corresponding to 1220nm, 1630nm, 2190nm wavelengths respectively, which are colors not visible to the human eye).

Magnitude B (Blue, 445nm) 14.8

Magnitude J (IR 1220nm) 13.81

Magnitude H (IR 1630nm) 13.05

Magnitude K (IR 2190nm) 12.54

For more information about photometry in astronomy, check the photometric system article on Wikipedia.

The surface brightess reported below is an indication of the brightness per unit of angular area of IC 549.

Apparent Size

The following table reports IC 549 apparent angular size. The green area displayed on top of the DSS2 image of IC 549 is a visual representation of it.

Major Angular Size 0.6 arcmin

Minor Angular Size 0.37 arcmin

Position Angle 180°

Morphological Classification

IC 549 - Irregular Galaxy in Sextans is classified as Irregular (I) according to the Hubble and de Vaucouleurs galaxy morphological classification. The diagram below shows a visual representation of the position of IC 549 - Irregular Galaxy in Sextans in the Hubble de Vaucouleurs sequence.
